meanings.definition: The act of assuming something again.
meanings.sent1: After losing his keys, he made the reassumption that they were in his jacket pocket.
meanings.sent2: Her reassumption of the responsibility brought a sense of relief.
meanings.sent3: The reassumption of the last slice of cake caused laughter among the guests.
meanings.sent4: His reassumption of the lead role was like reclaiming a lost treasure.
meanings.sent5: The reassumption of her childhood innocence was a heartwarming moment.

meanings.definition: The belief or acceptance of something as true again.
meanings.sent1: With new evidence, the reassumption of his innocence became stronger.
meanings.sent2: Her reassumption of his loyalty was a comforting thought.
meanings.sent3: The reassumption of the sun rising from the west was a funny joke.
meanings.sent4: The reassumption of her love for him was like rediscovering a forgotten song.
meanings.sent5: The reassumption of magic in the world made everything seem brighter.
